intro: Microloma calycinum var. flavescens, commonly known as the golden microloma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. It produces small, clustered inflorescences that bloom throughout the growing season. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its vibrant color and unique appearance.
